itineraries.title: ISTANBUL IN 1 VISIT = 1 DAY MODE: FROM SULTANS TO THE BOSPHORUS

visits.text: Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Camii) – interior with 20,000 Iznik tiles

activities.text: Tour of the hippodrome square (obelisk, Wilhelm II fountain)

visits.text: Hagia Sophia (Ayasofya) – imperial basilica turned mosque

activities.text: Exterior route: ablution fountain and views of Ayasofya square

visits.text: Topkapi Palace – courtyards, kiosks and treasures

activities.text: Walk in the adjacent Gülhane gardens

visits.text: Istanbul Archaeological Museum – sarcophagi and antiquities

activities.text: Overview of the three wings (Archaeology, Ancient Orient, Ceramics)

visits.text: Basilica Cistern – underground columns and Medusa heads

activities.text: Walking on walkways with sound and light
Thematic browsing (copper, carpets, jewelry) without rushed purchases

visits.text: Spice Bazaar (Mısır Çarşısı) – spices, Turkish delights, teas

activities.text: Strolling to the nearby New Mosque (Yeni Cami)

visits.text: Republic Monument (Taksim Square) – starting point of Istiklal

activities.text: Walking down Istiklal Caddesi on foot (historical landmarks)

visits.text: Hagia Triada Greek Orthodox Church – dome and iconostasis

activities.text: Exterior tower and forecourt on Taksim Square

visits.text: Saint Anthony of Padua Basilica (Beyoğlu) – neo-Gothic style

activities.text: Stop at the historic Çiçek Pasajı passage (architectural heritage)

visits.text: Galata Tower – panorama over the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus

activities.text: Route through steep alleys toward Karaköy
Choice of short (2 h) or long (to Anadolu Kavağı) depending on season
Terraced gardens with view over the Golden Horn

visits.text: Kadıköy – lively center on the Asian side (markets, pedestrian streets)

activities.text: Walk to the fish market (Kadıköy Çarşısı)
Art Nouveau landmarks along Bahariye Caddesi

visits.text: Fenerbahçe Park – green peninsula and coastal walkways

activities.text: Coastal loop walk to the viewpoints

visits.text: Chora Mosque (Kariye) – Byzantine mosaics and frescoes

activities.text: Tour of the nearby land walls

visits.text: Historic houses of Balat – colorful facades (Çoban Çeşmesi Sk.)

activities.text: Photo scouting in the sloping alleyways

visits.text: Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople and Saint George Church (Fener)

activities.text: Discovery of the interior and relics depending on opening hours

visits.text: Fener Mahallesi – small squares and lanes between Yıldırım and Vodina

activities.text: Urban route towards the historic Greek schools

visits.text: Saint Stephen Iron Church – entirely metallic structure

activities.text: View of the Golden Horn from the shore

visits.text: Hagia Irene – first courtyard of Topkapi (remarkable acoustics)

activities.text: Exterior tour within the imperial complex

visits.text: Tiled Pavilion (Çinili Köşk) – Seljuk and Ottoman earthenware
Museum of the History of Science and Technology in Islam (Gülhane)

activities.text: Astronomical and mechanical instruments from the 9th to 16th century

visits.text: Eminönü – shores of the Golden Horn, quays and squares

activities.text: Great Post Office Museum (PTT Müzesi) on Ankara Caddesi
Tour of the square and quays depending on construction work

visits.text: Süreyya Opera (Kadıköy) – historic Art Deco hall
Museum of Illusions (Istiklal) – playful visual experiences

seo.h1_title: ISTANBUL DEEP DIVE: SULTANS, BAZAARS AND BOSPHORUS SECRETS
seo.intro_paragraph: Wander through Sultanahmet between domes and mosaics, then lose yourself in the Grand Bazaar and its endless passages. Cross to Kadıköy to feel the other shore, explore Balat and its colorful facades, then sail the Bosphorus in evening light. Istanbul is lived neighborhood by neighborhood, with a density of stories at every corner.
seo.seo_hook: Minarets piercing dawn sky, bazaar spices scenting ancient lanes, ferry horns echoing across straits. Istanbul, a thousand cities in one.

itineraries.title: FROM TROY TO CAPPADOCIA: AEGEAN SEA AND LUNAR LANDSCAPES

visits.text: Visit to the archaeological site of Troy, famous for its ancient ruins and the legend of the wooden horse.
Stop in Eceabat to see the replica of the Trojan horse from the movie.

activities.text: Ferry crossing from Eceabat to Çanakkale.
Sunset stroll through the quiet streets of Bergama.

visits.text: Cable car ride up to the Acropolis of Pergamon and exploration of ancient ruins.
Free stroll in downtown Izmir in the evening, particularly along the Kordon waterfront.

activities.text: Coffee and fresh juice break near the archaeological site.

visits.text: Walk on the travertines of Pamukkale and exploration of the ancient site of Hierapolis.

activities.text: Sunset observation over the white pools of Pamukkale.

visits.text: Journey through Anatolian landscapes to Göreme.

activities.text: Stops in local villages and cafés along the route.
Sunset walk in Göreme among the fairy chimneys.

visits.text: Hot air balloon flight at sunrise over Cappadocia.
Walking discovery of the troglodyte village of Göreme.
Excursion to Mustafapaşa, former Greek village with stone houses and picturesque alleys.

activities.text: Visit to the Göreme Open Air Museum.

visits.text: Discovery of the abandoned site of Burj Al Babas, a complex of unfinished castles.
Walk through the old Ottoman city of Mudurnu.

activities.text: Stop at Lake Abant, famous for its mountain landscapes and forest trails.

seo.h1_title: TURKEY CROSSROADS: AEGEAN RUINS TO CAPPADOCIA MOONSCAPE
seo.intro_paragraph: Follow the Aegean coast from Pergamon and its perched acropolis, then wander through Izmir between bazaars and seafront. Reach Pamukkale for its white terraces and hot waters, before ending in Göreme, at the heart of Cappadocia. There, fairy chimneys and carved stone give the impression of entering another world.
seo.seo_hook: Acropoles crowning coastal hills, travertine terraces cascading like frozen falls, fairy chimneys piercing rose dawn. Turkey, bridge between worlds.

itineraries.title: FROM THE AEGEAN SEA TO CAPPADOCIA: 2 UNFORGETTABLE WEEKS IN TURKEY

activities.text: Day 1: Stroll along the marina and swimming at Bodrum beach

seo.h1_title: TURKEY COMPLETE: TURQUOISE COAST TO CAPPADOCIA WONDER
seo.intro_paragraph: Sail from Bodrum and its white harbor, then travel back in time at Ephesus among ancient marbles. Relax at Pamukkale, before cruising the turquoise coast by gulet and walking toward Olympos, ruins and pine forest. End in Cappadocia at Göreme, where cave hotels and sunrise change the perspective.
seo.seo_hook: Gulets gliding through turquoise bays, marble columns catching Mediterranean light, hot air balloons drifting above stone valleys. Turkey, millennia in days.

itineraries.title: ESSENTIAL CAPPADOCIA IN 6 DAYS: VALLEYS, ROCK CHURCHES AND LUNAR LANDSCAPES

visits.text: Sultan Han, large Seljuk caravanserai on the Konya–Aksaray route
Yüksek Kilise (High Church) on promontory overlooking the lake near Güzelyurt
Troglodyte monastery of Selime and panoramas at the southern end of Ihlara valley

activities.text: Photo stops on the Aksaray → Güzelyurt route (volcanic viewpoints)

visits.text: Valley of the monasteries of Güzelyurt (rock churches and troglodyte habitat)
Ihlara Valley (descent of about 350 steps, walk at the bottom of the canyon)
Churches of the Ihlara Valley: Sümbüllü Church, Yılanlı Church, Pürenli Seki, Kokar Church

activities.text: Walk along the Melendiz Çayı with footbridge crossings

visits.text: Hike in the Rose Valley (Güllüdere I) from the Ortahisar/Çavuşin panorama, rock-cut churches (Haçlı, Üzümlü)
Uçhisar Castle (natural castle) with 360° views over the valleys
Guvercinlik (Pigeon Valley) between Uçhisar and Göreme

activities.text: Scouting of trail markers (G1/G2/M) and photo points at sunset/sunrise

visits.text: Keşlik Monastery (near Cemil): rock-cut churches and monastic spaces
Soğanlı Valley (Kayseri): Tokalı, Gök, Karabaş, Yılanlı, Kubbeli (with dome), Saklı, Tahtalı, Geyikli

activities.text: Walking loop in the two branches of Soğanlı Valley (paved tracks and trails)

visits.text: Göreme Open-Air Museum (UNESCO): Saint Basil, Elmali, Barbara, Yılanlı, Çarıklı, Karanlık Church
Mustafapaşa: Ottoman Greek architecture and walk to the troglodytic site of Golgoli
Kılıçlar Vadisi (Valley of Swords): sharp formations and small chapels
Paşabağ (Fairy Chimneys) between Çavuşin and Zelve
Devrent (Imagination/Pink Valley): zoomorphic rocks and free walk

activities.text: Photographic sequence Paşabağ → Devrent via Zelve, short stops along the D302

visits.text: Ürgüp: traditional market and Temenni Tepesi (urban view and central rock formation)
Göreme: urban walk and peripheral viewpoints over the valleys

activities.text: Reconnaissance tour for itinerary variations (Red/Meskendir/Love valleys depending on time)

seo.h1_title: CAPPADOCIA ESSENTIAL: VALLEYS, CAVE CHURCHES AND BALLOONS
seo.intro_paragraph: Walk through Rose Valley, canyons of warm hues and gentle trails, then explore Göreme and its rock-cut churches with ancient frescoes. Rise at sunrise by balloon above fairy chimneys, then find the night in a cave hotel carved from tuff. In Cappadocia, stone and light make all the show.
seo.seo_hook: Hot air balloons blooming in rose dawn, rock churches guarding Byzantine secrets, fairy chimneys piercing lunar valleys. Cappadocia, out of time.
featured_list: Hot Air Balloons: sunrise valley flight

activities.text: Hiking in canyon with rock churches
Visit local cafes in historic mansions

seo.h1_title: TURKEY GRAND TOUR: AEGEAN SHORES TO EASTERN FRONTIERS
seo.intro_paragraph: Begin in Istanbul and its Byzantine grandeur, then glide toward Aegean islands, between harbors and coves. Then dive at Kaş into limpid water, before reaching Cappadocia and its sculpted landscapes. Head up to Trabzon by the Black Sea, then speed toward Mount Nemrut and Mardin, where stone takes Mesopotamian accents.
seo.seo_hook: Stone heads contemplating sunrise on summits, tea terraces cascading toward the Black Sea, golden minarets crowning plains. Turkey, north to south.
